newsitem.title: DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO: Zairean currency to be replaced, minister says.
newsitem.headline: Zairean currency to be replaced, minister says.

text.p: Laurent Kabila's finance minister said on Wednesday the authorities would replace the former government's new zaire with a currency to be called the congolese franc and would print no new bank notes until it was introduced.
Mawampanga Mwanananga gave no timing for the switch, one of many planned in the former Zaire following the civil war victory of Kabila's Alliance of Democratic Froces for the Liberation of Congo.
"Monetary reform is conducted to the surprise of everyone to avoid speculation," he told Reuters.
The new zaire currently trades at 120,000 to the U.S. dollar on the parallel market in Kinshasa, capital of Kabila's Democratic Republic of the Congo.
The government fixed the official rate last Friday at 125,000 to the dollar. It says it will fix the rate every Friday.
